image.altText: A dog with brown curly hair sits in the middle of a dirt road surrounded by grass.

props.synopsis: Owners of dogs bought from breeder Tasmanian Labradoodles have spoken out about significant problems and large vet bills, after the breeder reached an out-of-court agreement with the RSPCA to shut down immediately.

title.children: 'It wasn't the right dog': Labradoodle owners consider legal action after Tasmanian business shuts amid overbreeding allegations

image.altText: A woman wearing a cap stands in front of palm trees

props.synopsis: A government review into Israel's response to an air strike that killed Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom and six others found "serious" procedural failures and errors in decision-making led to their deaths.

title.children: 'Serious' IDF failures led to death of World Central Kitchen aid workers in Gaza

image.altText: A group of men celebrate at Australia's largest Indigenous gathering.

props.synopsis: A senior Yol≈ãu leader says a treaty between the Commonwealth and First Nations people will likely not happen for decades, as the opposition leader promises "no treaty" at a federal level.

title.children: 'I won't be here': Senior elder's prediction for treaty after Voice vote

image.altText: Fighters in camouflage stand in front of a coffin with a large picture of Fuad Shukr displayed on the wall behind

props.synopsis: The leader of Lebanese militant group Hezbollah warns that the conflict with Israel is in a "new phase", as he addresses mourners at the funeral of a commander from the group who was killed by an Israeli air strike this week in Beirut.

title.children: Hezbollah leader says war with Israel has entered 'new phase' after killings of top militant figures

image.altText: Words ABC Tassiecast on top of green map of Tasmania with different Tasmanian icons

props.synopsis: Tasmania is a mecca for bushwalkers, but our state's wild places are challenging. How do locals and visitors alike stay safe? Reporter Alison Costelloe joins Airlie Ward.¬†

title.children: TassieCast episode 4: Trekking in Tassie ‚Äî beautiful but potentially deadly

image.altText: A large white and yellow ship with cranes and lifeboats on the side.

props.synopsis: Plans for a major wharf upgrade for Australia's Antarctic icebreaker have been scaled back after the initial $515 million cost estimate was deemed "exorbitant", an inquiry has heard.

title.children: 'Ground zero': Antarctic icebreaker's wharf upgrade revised to rein in 'exorbitant' costs

image.altText: Biden embraces Paul

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden has welcomed home the three Americans who were sentenced to years in Russian penal colonies after secret "sham" trials and now free under a major East-West prisoner swap.¬†

title.children: Alliances 'stepped up' and 'took a chance': Biden and Harris meet with prisoners released by Russia

image.altText: A painted bike symbol on a new bike lane on a Hobart road

props.synopsis: By introducing bike lanes and hook turns for cyclists, Hobart City Council is making room for an influx of bike travel. But what will it take to convince motorists to change their habits?

title.children: Hobart's grand plan to reduce car congestion and become a cycling city

image.altText: A large round-roofed stadium seen behind and to the side of a Cenotaph.

props.synopsis: RSL Tasmania says its concerns about a new AFL stadium on Hobart's waterfront have not been eased by new images showing how the structure will affect the view from the Cenotaph.

title.children: 'It will destroy sightlines': RSL unswayed by new images of proposed Hobart stadium from Cenotaph

image.altText: A woman with windswept, dark hair wearing a black coat and white blouse turns a street corner with autumn foliage.

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian MP Kathryn Hay has pleaded not guilty to a charge of emotional abuse or intimidation. The hearing in the Launceston Magistrates Court has ended, and the case will return to court in October.

title.children: Former MP and Miss Australia says she pleaded guilty to a previous charge of assaulting her ex-husband 'to let it go'

image.altText: Kamala Harris, wearing a light blue suit, walks up an aircraft staircase and waves.

props.synopsis: Two weeks since Trump narrowly avoided assassination, the race for the White House is upended ‚Äì and the Republican contender has long abandoned his short-lived shift to a "nice" tone.¬†

title.children: As Trump questions Harris's racial identity, Democrats are trying a simple message: He and Vance are 'weird'

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus holds her fist up after winning a swim race whlile Katie Ledecky comes over lane rope to congratulate

props.synopsis: The rivalry between Olympic champions Ariarne Titmus and Katie Ledecky continues on day seven as the pair will be side-by-side in the women's 800m freestyle heats. Follow live.

title.children: Titmus and Ledecky go head-to-head to start day seven

image.altText: Mobile phone tower

props.synopsis: With nearly 200,000 Australians relying on 3G coverage, rural residents are especially concerned they will be left without mobile service if the shutdown proceeds.

title.children: Senate committee recommends delay to 3G shutdown as mobile users fear loss of coverage

image.altText: NDIS minister BIll Shorten.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of participants and businesses that are part of the National Disability Insurance Scheme should be subject to a tiered, risk-proportionate registration process, a government-appointed taskforce recommends.

title.children: It split the disability community ‚Äì and now we have more information on one of the most controversial areas of NDIS reform

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds with Parliament House in the backdrop.

props.synopsis: The defamation action launched by WA Senator Linda Reynolds against Brittany Higgins and her partner David Sharaz is now underway in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: 'Every fairytale needs a villain': Linda Reynolds staunchly defends role in Higgins saga

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Higgins accused of delaying reporting alleged rape to police

image.altText: A pet owner cradles her cat.

props.synopsis: When George the cat went AWOL, he left his Adelaide owner Jess van Niekerk fearing the worst. Two-and-a-half years later, she was in the middle of a lesson at the primary school where she teaches when she got a simple text message: "George is alive".

title.children: Drainpipe cat reunited with owner after more than two years on the run

image.altText: Video screenshots of a man holding a knife.

props.synopsis: A gruesome video showing a bush-knife wielding gang decapitating the dead body of a villager in PNG's East Sepik province emerges on social media, as local police use the footage to track down the alleged perpetrators. Warning, this story contains graphic content.¬†

title.children: Gang celebrates decapitation of Papua New Guinean villager in online video

image.altText: Tara police officers Matthew Arnold, 26, and Rachel McCrow, 29, were both fatally killed at Wieambilla on Monday afternoon.

props.synopsis: Police officers have broken down before an inquest, recounting their efforts to rescue a colleague and retrieve the bodies of two constables killed at Wieambilla in 2022.¬†

title.children: 'I knew they were gone': Officer in tears recounting moment she knew two colleagues had been shot dead

image.altText: Drone photos of the Kwinana big battery Stage One

props.synopsis: Like much of the country, WA is embracing rooftop solar with breathtaking gusto. But the state's position as the world's biggest island grid is posing a unique problem with authorities asking the question ‚Äî how much solar is too much solar?

title.children: How the rise of solar power in Western Australia is a cautionary tale for the world

image.altText: 5qhmurray

props.synopsis: It was another golden day in the pool for Australia, but plenty happening throughout the Paris Olympics that you might not have seen on the TV. Here's today's quick hits from the Games.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Daggy dad goes viral, Murray's cheeky tweet, and sponsor gets tongues wagging

image.altText: GettyImages-2164158332

props.synopsis: Boris Van Der Vorst defends the IOC over its handling of gender testing, as an Italian boxer quits mid-fight against Algerian Imane Khelif.

title.children: 'Sad situation for all boxers': Head of World Boxing addresses issues over gender after Italian boxer quits mid-round

image.altText: Two men playing tennis in green and gold clothing

props.synopsis: Australian tennis veterans John Peers and Matt Ebden must beat American singles stars Tommy Paul and Taylor Fritz to win an Olympic tennis doubles medal.

title.children: The Aussie 'old stagers' that have snuck into a medal-winning position at Paris Olympics

image.altText: A woman holds a gun and another woman rides a bike.

props.synopsis: A town of 3,800 residents in the heart of Victorian dairy farming country has won more medals at the Paris Games than Argentina, Ecuador and Brazil.

title.children: The tiny Australian town that has won more Olympic medals than entire countries

image.altText: 2024-07-31T163618Z_1384351195_UP1EK7V1A4DST_RTRMADP_3_OLYMPICS-2024-CANOESLALOM (1)

props.synopsis: From the pool to River Seine, see the magical moments for athletes from week one of the Games.¬†

title.children: The most stunning images from the 2024 Paris Olympics

image.altText: A group of men throw peace signs for the camera

props.synopsis: Iran blames Israel for the assassination of a Hamas leader in Tehran this week, saying it has a "duty" to seek revenge. So, what might Iran do next?

title.children: An assassination on Iranian soil is a 'huge, humiliating blow'. Here are the three ways they might respond

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man in a gingham shirt

props.synopsis: Mr Navalny, the fiercest political foe of Russian President Vladimir Putin, died in February in an Arctic penal colony while serving a 19-year sentence on extremism charges.

title.children: Former Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was meant to be included in prisoner swap

image.altText: Rex Airlines logo on the fuselage of one of its aircraft, 2007

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Rex Airlines employees have been officially let go from the regional carrier after receiving formal notices of termination.

title.children: Hundreds of Rex Airlines staff notified of termination after carrier enters voluntary administration

image.altText: PinkPantheress sits side on in a room with dark blue curtains and leopard print wall

props.synopsis: "I will not be able to continue with the rest of my live shows this year in order to focus on my physical health and overall wellbeing," the 23-year-old singer posted overnight.

title.children: English pop star PinkPantheress cancels Australian tour, including Coldplay stadium shows

image.altText: Blonde woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Officers are appealing for information as they try to understand how psychologist Frances Crawford, 49, died at her Queensland property.

title.children: Police investigate woman's suspicious death involving lawn mower

image.altText: Forensic officers near a small plane that has crashed in a field.

props.synopsis: After an inquest earlier this year, a Victorian coroner delivers his findings into a mid-air collision in 2020 between two planes in Mangalore, north of Melbourne.

title.children: Lack of communication between planes led to collision that killed four pilots, coroner finds

image.altText: A composite image of two horses in a dressage competition and Snoop Dogg.

props.synopsis: Snoop Dogg has said he's excited to meet the horse that starred in his viral Tokyo 2020 reaction video. Here's why that could prove tricky.

title.children: Who is Snoop Dogg's favourite horse? It could be a case of mistaken identity

image.altText: A large industrial ship in the Pacific.

props.synopsis: Mining companies hope to begin mining the sea floor for valuable metals soon ‚Äî upping the stakes at a vote for the top role at the international regulator.

title.children: A high-stakes vote could decide the future of deep-sea mining

image.altText: Police carry boxes they have seized from a tobacco store.

props.synopsis: Health officials and police are cracking down the sale of illicit vapes, cigarettes and "chop chop" tobacco in Queensland. In the Wide Bay area alone sellers are estimated to have avoided paying about $1.2 million in tax.

title.children: Almost 500,000 black market cigarettes, 380kg of 'chop chop' seized in Queensland raids

image.altText: A close-up of a person's hands, wearing garden gloves and holding a handful of brown wood mulch.

props.synopsis: One of the easiest ways to show your garden some TLC is by mulching it. But what are the benefits of mulching, what varieties are available, and which ones are the best for your purposes?

title.children: Why mulch is good for your garden and the best types to use

image.altText: Cattle grazing on a vast, dry outback plain.

props.synopsis: An investment company owned by the Canadian government gets early approval to take over the debt-plagued Yeeda Pastoral Company.

title.children: One of the Kimberley's oldest cattle stations set to shift to Canadian ownership
